feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService
feed.rights: Copyright Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited, 2025. Licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 70 to 90 mm of rain, especially in the ranges. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 60 to 80 mm of rain, especially in the ranges. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h expected from Saturday evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Orange Warning has been decreased to Minimal as expected rainfall amounts have been reduced.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 80 to 100 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected with the front. Thunderstorms possible this morning. Note: Another front is expected to bring a period of heavy rain from Monday. Warnings for that event should be expected after the current event is over. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 80 to 100 mm of rain about the main divide, and 70 to 90 mm within 15 km farther east. Peak rates of 20 to 30 mm/h and possible thunderstorms this morning about the divide. Freezing level 2400 metres. Note: Another front is expected to bring a period of heavy rain from Monday. Warnings for that event should be expected after the current event is over. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 120km/h in exposed places. Note: Another front is expected to bring a period of potential severe gales on Monday. Warnings for that event should be expected after the current event is over. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is likely about the road early tomorrow morning. Up to 1 cm may accumulate above 600 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is likely about the road early tomorrow morning. Up to 1 cm may accumulate above 600 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is expected about the road overnight and early tomorrow morning. 5 to 10 cm may accumulate about the highest part of the road with lesser amounts down to 600 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
